Detailed Description

Wizard page on which user selects a list of players.

This wizard page includes a large list box showing the current players loaded for the tournament, as well as buttons allowing the user to add and remove different types of players. Right-click on a player shows a pop-up menu.

Member Function Documentation

void PlayersPage::AddPlayer ( Player *  player ) [private]

Add a player to the internal list and fire an add-player event.

This function encapsulates the portion of the player-adding logic shared between the two add-player buttons -- adding the player to the internal players array, and sending the wxEVT_ADD_PLAYER event.

Parameters:
playerThe player to be added
void PlayersPage::OnAddBuiltinButton ( wxCommandEvent &  event ) [private]

void PlayersPage::OnContextMenu ( wxContextMenuEvent &  event ) [private]

Called when the user wants a context menu for the player list.

This function displays our pop-up menu.

Parameters:
eventThe event generated
void PlayersPage::OnDataUpdate ( wxNotifyEvent &  event ) [private]

Called when the page receives a 'data update' message.

This function updates the view after the data has been updated. Notably, when a player is added from this page, we add the player, broadcast the wxEVT_ADD_PLAYER message, and then call LogosWizard::Update(). Then, the update event invokes this event handler, which triggers a UI update.

Parameters:
eventThe event generated
bool PlayersPage::OnFileDrop ( const wxArrayString &  files )

Add a dropped list of FSA players.

Called from the drag-and-drop code, adds a list of players to the tournament.

Parameters:
filesThe list of filenames
Returns:
True if the add was entirely successful, false if not

void PlayersPage::OnNext ( wxWizardEvent &  event ) [private]

Called when the wizard moves to the next page.

This function makes sure that at least one player has been added to the tournament before allowing the user to advance to the next page.

Parameters:
eventThe event generated

void PlayersPage::RemovePlayer ( size_t  playerIndex ) [private]

Remove a player from the internal list and fire a remove-player event.

This function encapsulates the portion of the player-removing logic shared between the remove player button and the right-click menu -- removing the player from our internal players array, and sending the wxEVT_REMOVE_PLAYER event.

Parameters:
playerIndexThe internal array index of the player to be removed

Player* PlayersPage::menuPlayer [private]

The player right-clicked while a pop-up menu is active.

This member is set to the player that has been right-clicked when a pop-up menu is opened. It is used by the various pop-up menu event handlers.

int PlayersPage::menuPlayerIndex [private]

The index of the player right-clicked while a pop-up menu is active.

This member is set to the array index of the player that has been right-clicked when a pop-up menu is opened. It is used by the various pop-up menu event handlers.
